Joe is hooking up his hifi system. His amplifier is claimed to be able to pump \($P\)W RMS into his \($RL\Omega\) speaker. From the point of view of the speaker, the amplifier can be modeled as a Thevenin source with an internal resistance of \(R_{TH}=$RTH\Omega\).
What is the maximum open-circuit voltage, in Volts RMS, that the amplifier can deliver?
Joe buys a roll of #18AWG speaker wire. He needs to run \($l\)m of wire (a \($l2\)m round trip) to the speaker from his amplifier. The resistance of #18AWG copper wire is about \($rwk\Omega\)/km.
If Joe uses the wire he bought to connect the amplifier to the speaker then when his amplifier is putting out \($va\)V RMS at the amplifier terminals, what is the voltage, in Volts RMS, at the speaker terminals?
